direct_answer.text: Based on the calculations we discussed earlier, if 20% of the population believes in favor of horse ownership, this means that around 1,574,225 people share this belief among them according to their numbers. These people represent almost one sixth of the overall sampled set. It’s important to keep in mind though that while calculating statistics like this provides useful estimates, individual views may vary widely even within any single statistic category. Variables including age, geographical location, personal experiences etc could influence someone's attitude towards owning a pet horse significantly! Still, assuming uniform distribution across all groups might help better predict future trends too since humans tend naturally follow patterns albeit not perfectly always nor uniformly sometimes things change unexpected ways but generally speaking looking back historically most likely certain behaviors become apparent again eventually showing consistent recurrence pattern emerges leading repeated observations revealing underlying principles governing phenomena observed causing similar effects repeatedly happening frequently occurring habitually repeating themselves year round seasonality cycle natural rhythm regular occurrence repetition periodicity periodic nature cyclic phenomenon repeat/reiteration series sequence order linear arrangement progressiveness forward direction movement continuation path evolution trajectory transition phases stages steps iterations cycles turnaround time span duration interval length
